content.question:
The x axis ranges from negative 4 to 4 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from negative 4 to 4 in increments of 1. All coordinates are approximate. Moving from left to right:

The curve enters the window at (negative 4.5 comma negative 3.2).

The curve increases in nearly a straight line to reach a high point at (negative 1.5 comma negative 2.2).

The curve decreases sharply to exit the window at (negative 1.1 comma negative 4.5). 

A second section of the curve enters the window at (negative 0.9 comma 4.5) and decreases sharply to reach the origin, a low point. 

The curve then increases sharply to exit the window at (0.9 comma 4.5). 

A third section of the curve enters the window at (1.1 comma negative 4.5).

The curve increases sharply to reach the point (1.2 comma negative 1). 

The curve continues to increase and nearly follow a line to exit the window at (4.5 comma 1.3).

​The graph of the rational function <math alttext="r"><mi>r</mi></math> is shown. Which of the following tables could be used to describe the asymptotic behavior of <math alttext="r"><mi>r</mi></math> at <math alttext="x equals negative 1"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></math> and at <math alttext="x equals 1"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></math> ?

choices.label:
​

<math><munder><mi>lim</mi><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mo>-</mo><msup><mn>1</mn><mo>-</mo></msup></mrow></munder><mi>r</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math>
<math><munder><mi>lim</mi><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mo>-</mo><msup><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo></msup></mrow></munder><mi>r</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math>
<math><munder><mi>lim</mi><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><msup><mn>1</mn><mo>-</mo></msup></mrow></munder><mi>r</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math>
<math><munder><mi>lim</mi><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><msup><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo></msup></mrow></munder><mi>r</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math>
<math alttext="infinity"><mo>∞</mo></math>
<math alttext="negative infinity"><mo>-</mo><mo>∞</mo></math>
<math alttext="negative infinity"><mo>-</mo><mo>∞</mo></math>
<math alttext="infinity"><mo>∞</mo></math>

​

<math><munder><mi>lim</mi><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mo>-</mo><msup><mn>1</mn><mo>-</mo></msup></mrow></munder><mi>r</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math>
<math><munder><mi>lim</mi><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mo>-</mo><msup><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo></msup></mrow></munder><mi>r</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math>
<math><munder><mi>lim</mi><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><msup><mn>1</mn><mo>-</mo></msup></mrow></munder><mi>r</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math>
<math><munder><mi>lim</mi><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><msup><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo></msup></mrow></munder><mi>r</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math>
<math alttext="negative infinity"><mo>-</mo><mo>∞</mo></math>
<math alttext="infinity"><mo>∞</mo></math>
<math alttext="infinity"><mo>∞</mo></math>
<math alttext="negative infinity"><mo>-</mo><mo>∞</mo></math>

content.answer:
​

<math><munder><mi>lim</mi><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mo>-</mo><msup><mn>1</mn><mo>-</mo></msup></mrow></munder><mi>r</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math>
<math><munder><mi>lim</mi><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mo>-</mo><msup><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo></msup></mrow></munder><mi>r</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math>
<math><munder><mi>lim</mi><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><msup><mn>1</mn><mo>-</mo></msup></mrow></munder><mi>r</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math>

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Construct equivalent graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations of functions that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context, with and without technology.
